m_szDocSumamry: Battery-electric and fuel-cell cars each have their own drawbacks (Study) February 4, 2016 | In: Surveys & Reports 2 Comments Battery-electric cars and hydrogen fuel-cell vehicles have a lot in common. They’re both powered by electricity, although they get it from different sources. And they’re both zero-emission vehicles pitched as a way to cut oil consumption and harmful emissions. Each type of vehicle has its own advocates, but what if you’re a buyer trying to choose between the two? Like anything else, battery-electric and hydrogen fuel-cell cars come with their own distinct pros and cons,
